name: Phnom Penh
fun_fact: Fun fact: Nom Banh Chok, Cambodia's national dish of fermented rice noodles, is traditionally sold by women carrying it on their shoulders walking through streets at dawn - a tradition unchanged for centuries!

hero_dishes.name: Nom Banh Chok
hero_dishes.description: Fermented rice noodles with fragrant fish curry sauce, lemongrass, turmeric, basil and mint
hero_dishes.origin_story: Cambodia's national dish, handmade noodles unchanged for centuries
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Sold by walking vendors at dawn, traditional markets

hero_dishes.name: Bai Sach Chrouk
hero_dishes.description: Marinated pork with rice - the quintessential Cambodian breakfast
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Corner of Street 19 and Norodom Boulevard, evening street grills

hero_dishes.name: Fish Amok
hero_dishes.description: Traditional Khmer steamed fish curry in banana leaf
hero_dishes.origin_story: Origins trace back to the Khmer Empire era

hero_dishes.name: Lok Lak
hero_dishes.description: Marinaded beef cubes cooked rare, served with fried rice
hero_dishes.origin_story: French-Vietnamese influenced dish adapted into Khmer cuisine
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Local restaurants and street food stalls

signature_drinks.name: Fresh coconut juice
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: From street carts, especially near markets
